Eiko Eurya Kuramae

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/5770577498868100
  • Última atualização do currículo em 18/07/2019

I graduated in Agronomy at University of Sao Paulo State, Faculty of Agronomic Sciences (UNESP-FCA) in 1987, Brazil; MSc in Molecular Biology at Vrije Universiteit Brussel (VUB) in 1991, Belgium; PhD in Biological Sciences-Genetics at University of Sao Paulo State (UNESP in 1995, Brazil). At the moment I am Senior Scientist and Project Manager of the Netherlands Institute of Ecology (NIOO/KNAW), Wageningen, The Netherlands. My expertise are on ecological and environmental genomics, genomics, soil microbial ecology, molecular ecology, microbiology and bionformatics. My primary research interest is on understanding the patterns and mechanisms of interactions among soil-borne microbes and their environment, how these interactions shape the structure and affect the functioning of microbial communities and, consequently, of ecosystems. My major topics are microbial diversity loss, climate change, land use change and bio-informatics. Besides the coordination and execution of many Dutch and international fundamental research programs I am also strongly involved in the development of bio-based tools which can be used in soil health and environmental quality. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Outras informações
Soil-borne microbes perform essential services to the sustainable function of all ecosystems, such as the cycling of nutrients and primary production. In order to understand these systems and to solve the major problems that are associated with human impact on their functioning, comprehensive knowledge of the microbiology of these systems is required. My primary focus is on understanding the patterns and mechanisms of interactions among microbes and their environment, how these interactions shape the structure and affect the functioning of microbial communities and, consequently, of ecosystems. My major topics are: Microbial diversity loss - Loss of soil-borne microbial diversity vs. plant production (plant biomass quality and secondary metabolites); Climate Change - The aims are to decipher the processes underlying the enormous microbial diversity and to elucidate its functional relevance and to improve our knowledge on the microbial production and removal of greenhouse gases N2O, CO2 , CH4; Land use changes- based on our knowledge of the behavior of bacterial and fungal communities under different soil conditions, we develop (1) microbial bio-indicators to predict the consequences of changes in land use due to abandoning of agricultural land, deforestation or changes in arable cropping regimes, (2) bio-indicators genes in key functions (nitrification, nitrogen fixation, denitrification), recalcitrant organic matter decomposition most indicative of specific soil status, in particular in soils with crops for biofuel; Development of sustainable biomass production systems. Sustainable biomass production for the bio-based economy requires fundamental knowledge on the impact of these systems on the microbial communities of the soils under production; Bioinformatics - develop tools to integrate genomics, post-genomics and environmental/soil physicochemical data into soil microbial ecology.

2015 - Atual
Unravelling the mechanisms underlying health and productivity promoting agricultural practices by fine-mapping rhizosphere communities
Descrição: Plants select, foster and attract parts of the soil living community. Plants select soil micro-biota involved in nutrient uptake, and organismal groups that mediate both specific and general disease suppressiveness. This selection of rhizosphere communities is plant-species specific (Turner et al. 2013, Mendes, Kuramae et al. 2014). The fostering of a subset of the soil living community is observed in strongly increased densities of specific organismal groups. This not only holds for bacteria, archaea and fungi, but also for protozoa, bacteri and fungivorous nematodes. In addition, plant roots attract pathogens such as bacteria, oomycetes, fungi and nematodes. The notion of crop-specific rhizosphere microbiomes evokes the question whether easily transferable, common soil management measures that are reported to be beneficial for sustainable crop production such as reduced tillage and the addition of multiple levels and kinds of organic matter and/or composts, can be understood and fully exploited in future-proof arable crop production. This proposal includes a detailed characterisation of the rhizosphere community at taxonomical and functional levels under field conditions for two dicots and three monocots: potato and pea (legume), and leek, barley and maize. We will focus on the quantitatively most relevant functional groups in the 1st and 2nd trophic layer of the soil food web: bacteria, fungi, protozoa, and bacteri-, fungivorous and plant parasitic nematodes. With these biological insights, we will monitor and try to understand mechanistically the effects of easily transferable soil management practices. These insights will allow us to formulate solid crop-specific advice for the optimal and durable management and exploitation of soil life..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Eiko Eurya Kuramae - Coordenador / SULEIMAN, AFNAN K. A. - Integrante / Johannes Helder - Integrante / Paula Harkes - Integrante.
2015 - Atual
Deciphering the gene machinery involved in the synthesis of Acidobacterial biopolymers and their biochemical characterization
Descrição: Acidobacteria is an abundant and ubiquitous bacterial phyla in soil, that shows no or mild growth in laboratory conditions. Based on genome sequences we estimated that Acidobacteria contains more genes related to carbohydrate metabolism than most (95%) of other bacterial genomes, and therefore Acidobacteria may play an active role in carbon cycling. Under certain stimulus Acidobacteria produces high amount of extracellular polymeric substances (EPS) and polyhydroxyalkanoates (PHA) with potential biotechnological and bioremediation applications. We are currently analyzing the genome/transcriptome/proteome of three Acidobacterial isolates and characterizing their byproducts by chemical and physical analyses..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Eiko Eurya Kuramae - Coordenador / KIELAK, ANNA M. - Integrante / Marcelo M. Zerillo - Integrante / Ohana Y. A. Costa - Integrante.
2015 - Atual
Diversidade microbiana de solos de áreas preservadas de diferentes Biomas no Maranhão
Descrição: Aprovado no Edital n° 40 / 2014 FAPEMA - Apoio a Projetos de Pesquisa ? UNIVERSAL. Faixa A. Processo 00378/15. Os estudos atuais de indicadores de qualidade ambiental tornaram-se necessários para promover os serviços ecossistêmicos e a aplicabilidade de métodos de avaliação de áreas preservadas. Os bioindicadores microbianos são considerados um dos mais importantes, pois estão diretamente envolvidos no ciclo da matéria. Portanto, objetiva-se avaliar a diversidade microbiana de 80 amostras de solos, obtidas de 40 áreas preservadas de diferentes biomas, utilizando sequenciamento de última geração, MiSeq, 16SrRNA (bactérias/arqueias) e ITS (fungos). Parte destas amostras já foram coletadas, e grande parte analisadas, na UFMA. Nas análises multivariadas, serão utilizados os resultados físico-químicos e a possível presença de contaminantes, de forma a se caracterizar a abundância, a diversidade e composição funcional da microbiota. Algumas áreas selecionadas (aprox. 33%) serão revisitadas, com a finalidade de acréscimo de dados importantes para os aspectos ecológicos, ex. vegetação adjacente, densidade e a camada de serapilheira. Tudo isto criará uma oportunidade única de conhecer a diversidade microbiana de solos diferentes biomas, com excepcional abrangência biológica e geográfica, e as múltiplas interações entre os microrganismos e as condições físico-químicas do solo, e com os fatores edafo-climáticos locais...
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Eiko Eurya Kuramae - Coordenador / Christoph Gehring - Integrante / Flávio Henrique Reis Moraes - Integrante / Márcio Fernandes Alves Leite - Integrante.
2015 - Atual
Identificação de microrganismos endofíticos (fungos e bactérias) de raízes da palmeira babaçu (Attalea speciosa Mart.)
Descrição: Projeto de pesquisa integrado aos macroprojetos do PPG em agroecologia da UEMA: Microbiota associada à palmeira babaçu (Attalea speciosa Mart.) e seus impactos na qualidade físico-química e nas comunidades microbiológicas dos solos arredores, financiado por intermédio do Universal da FAPEMA (APP-Universal-00727/13) e do projeto ?Impacts of land use and of the babassu palm on microbial community structure and function and on soil quality in Maranhão State, eastern periphery of Amazonia?, do programa PVE (Pesquisador Visitante Especial) da CAPES Edital Nº 71/2013 (A080/2013).
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

2012 - Atual
Greenhouse gas emissions (N2O, CO2 and CH4) from soil with sugarcane production and impact on microbial community structure and function (Coordinator)
Descrição: Sugarcane crops in Brazil grow with less nitrogen fertilizers than other biofuel crops, resulting into lower levels of nitrous oxide, a potent greenhouse gas. However, there is lack of real measurements of GHG emissions associated with the production ethanol. In addition, there is a lack of knowledge of the main players of fundamental biogeochemical processes, the soil biota, which can control fluxes of GHG..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Eiko Eurya Kuramae - Coordenador / Janaina Braga do Carmo - Integrante / Marcelo M. Zerillo - Integrante / Johnny R. Soares - Integrante / Leonardo M. Pitombo - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior - Auxílio financeiro.

2010 - 2012
Examining bacterial and fungal plant organic matter decomposition via integrated pyrosequencing-based approaches ERGO
Descrição: Both fungi and bacteria can be important in organic matter degradation in soils. This project seeks to utilize emerging pyrosequencing and stable isotope probing (SIP) technologies to allow for an in-depth and simultaneous examination of fungal and bacterial species and genes involved in organic matter degradation..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) Doutorado: (1) .

2010 - Atual
Development of a High-Throughput soil health array system
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Eiko Eurya Kuramae - Coordenador / Johannes A. van Veen - Integrante / George A. Kowalchuk - Integrante / Yao Pan - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research - Auxílio financeiro.
2009 - Atual
Monitoring the microbial diversity and functional activities in response to land-use changes and deforestation under soybean and sugarcane cultivations
Descrição: This study aims to determine the abundance of Acidobacteria and investigate the size, structure and composition of communities of Verrucomicrobia in different niches of the soil in southeast Brazilian Amazon converted to crop production..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Eiko Eurya Kuramae - Coordenador / Johannes A. van Veen - Integrante / Siu Mui Tsai - Integrante / Acacio A Navarrte - Integrante / Lucas W. Mendes - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior - Bolsa.
2007 - 2011
Genomic analysis of microbial community structure & Functional analysis of nutrient cycling
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
